title: Combat Depression and Maintain Will to Survive
brief: Prevent the shift from productive action to helplessness by maintaining hope and forward momentum.
steps: Allow brief moments of sadness when thinking of home, but set time limits (5-10 minutes).
Shift focus from 'there is nothing I can do' to 'what can I do right now.'
Set small, achievable daily goals like collecting 10 pieces of tinder.
Use thoughts of loved ones as motivation to try harder and survive another day.
Maintain physical activity even when feeling hopeless - movement combats depression.
Talk to team members about positive memories or future plans.
Celebrate small victories like successfully starting a fire or finding clean water.
warnings: Depression can sap all energy and destroy the will to survive.
The cycle of frustration-anger-depression can be self-reinforcing if not broken.
Giving up mentally often precedes physical death in survival situations.
